A nice spot to relax or get some fresh air with friends or family. Want me to add details about facilities or nearby¬†attractions

name: Tony Clark
comment: This park is in central Dallas. Being that I live in the Uptown area, I often pass by it. The park looks nice from the street view as you pass by. I had not actually been to it until I attended Wine Festival in August of 2024. There are some street parking spaces along the side of the park that appear to be first come first served; either that or they are metered. There are also paid parking lots very near by. I personally would not regularly go to the park because of the geographic location, but would attend another event if it were held there.PlaygroundTo my knowledge there is not a playground.RestroomsI do not believe there is a restroom.Dog-friendlinessThe park is dog friendly.Picnic areaIt would be a good place for a picnic

This city is so big on getting money but no leadership!!! Families are homeless losing more everyday the city allows these outside realstate companies come out here and charge you for a new place to live and then put you out.. The eviction process is nothing but a game to this city... There is no housing programs for working people there is no program for the young men or children and the young men grown up.To busy trying to lock people up and give them chargers to mess there future up!! But worried about parks but people can't even go to parks without being harassed by your polices...this city ain't what it use to be.. Become a victim of identity and try to explain that to the DPS they laugh at you..but what if it was your identity taken advantage by relatives..or etc..Alot of important people spoke up and made this city but the people we got representing the City of Dallas are weak and only paying there bills Pay the city you can do whatever you want

name: Yeganeh Bahraminejad
comment: I went to Dallas City Hall and was looking for a specific office. When I asked Felicia Gooch for help, she kindly came down several floors to show me where I needed to go. When she noticed that the office was closed, she walked back with me and showed me another place where I could get help. She was very kind and friendly, and even though it wasn‚Äôt part of her job, she guided me out of pure kindness. The security officers at the entrance and on the second floor were also very kind and helpful

name: Diana Yanez
comment: We went to dallas water and the person that took care of us was so helpful, also the men that is greeting everyone telling you what to do to get the process going was super nice

name: Allie MacCoy
comment: Government building

name: Kelly Terry
comment: I‚Äôm not sure if this is the right place to leave this review but if someone could pass this along to DFD, please do. I was at Kroger this morning and DFD had a ladder truck there to get groceries (I think Truck 19). My son loves fire trucks (he‚Äôs 5) and so we walked over to look at the truck. I thought all the firefighters were inside, but as we walked up to the truck, one of the firefighters was sitting in the front. He waved at us and as soon as we got close he jumped out and started talking to my son. He offered to show him the back, he was super friendly and seemed genuinely excited to show a young child his truck. It was incredibly nice and I just wanted to say thank you. It made a kid‚Äôs day, he talked about it the whole way home! Unfortunately I did not catch the firefighter‚Äôs name but he was a Lieutenant. That kind of community outreach is so important and deserves recognition. If anyone in the Dallas government knows who it might have been, tell him thank you for me

Weirdest thing I've ever experienced shut down to have my lunch in front of Dallas City Hall when did the benches at shady by a tree and was told by security that we couldn't sit there, they didn't give us any reason why that was solid
So I pay taxes I buy my loss but I can't sit on government property make some sense to me because they were running homeless people off however I'm not homeless

There is a lot of shade by the food trucks so it was perfect to sit on a table and grab a bite. There is also board games for the kids to play. So much to do we will definitely be back soonüòä

name: B Young
comment:
Klyde Warren Park Klyde Warren Park is a 5.2‚Äì5.4 acre deck park built over the recessed Woodall Rodgers Freeway in downtown Dallas, Texas, connecting Uptown, the Arts District, and the central business district as a major urban green space and gathering spot.It offers daily free programming, food options, and a mix of lawns, playgrounds, dog parks, fountains, and event spaces, making it one of the city‚Äôs most popular public destinations. Come visit ## Location and basics
Klyde Warren Park sits on a bridge deck spanning Woodall Rodgers Freeway between Pearl Street and St. Paul Street in the heart of downtown Dallas.[1][7][10] The park covers just over five acres and is open daily, typically from early morning to late evening, serving both residents and visitors. +26

name: BRAY H
comment: Klyde Warren Park in Uptown, Dallas, is always clean and pristine on weekends. You can find almost every type of food truck, kids' play areas, beautiful dancing fountains with music, tables, games, and lush green grass. The park also offers some of the best views of the skyscrapers in Dallas, adjacent to downtown and Uptown. It's a great place to start your morning by walking around Uptown and downtown. Numerous events are held here, making it a vibrant part of upscale Uptown

name: Edith Urbaez
comment: It‚Äôs a nice and welcoming park open to the public, with a variety of food trucks and a pet-friendly atmosphere. Perfect for family outings or catching up with friends.Dog-friendlinessYes, it‚Äôs dog friendlyPicnic areaThere are picnic areas

name: Shahida bilal
comment:
Klyde Warren Park is a 5-acre urban green space right in downtown Dallas, built over the Woodall Rodgers Freeway.
What makes it great:
It‚Äôs really well designed‚Äîwith lawns, a children‚Äôs playground, a dog park, water features, free public events (yoga, concerts, etc.).
Beautiful setting: connects Uptown and the Arts District; great views; clean and well‚Äêmaintained

name: Estreitta de Kluetz

I just wish Fort Worth had something

There are local food trucks and eateries to explore around the perimeter of the park and amazing water features and playground for kids

name: Yuliia Pliekhova
comment: Awesome Park is a unique and beautiful spot built right over the highway! It‚Äôs a cozy green space - clean, family-friendly, and perfect for a walk, a picnic, a date, or just relaxing. Great for kids too! +7

name: Javier Guerrero
comment:
My favorite park in Dallas!
There is something I like to do:
Go have dinner at Mi Cocina, it‚Äôs right there in the middle of the park‚Ä¶
After dinner you can walk around and enjoy the view

name: Sathish Kumar
comment: Perfect Spot to Cool Off and Relax in Downtown Dallas! We had a great time at Klyde Warren Park! The water play area was a hit‚Äîan absolute must for the Texas heat. We also enjoyed some fun at the foosball table and other kid-friendly games available around the park. It‚Äôs a lively and relaxing place right in the heart of downtown Dallas‚Äîperfect for chilling out, playing, or just soaking in the vibe. Highly recommended for families and anyone visiting the city!PlaygroundNot a typical playground.RestroomsRestrooms are cleanPicnic areaYea. Lots of tables available to grab and hang around

name: Animesh D
comment: Nice and busy park in the downtown. Parking is tight on weekends and needs to be on the street - paid but reasonable price $0.30 for one hour and after 6PM free. There is a children play area and well designed splash pad for kids. The overall quality and maintenance of the park is good. There‚Äôs a clean restroom present. +13

name: Josh
comment: Extensive linear park running over the freeway adjacent to the arts district. Lined with food trucks, it has a playground, several splash pad fountains, and long walks under shade trees. There is also an place for performances. Restrooms are located in the Southside midway down the park.PlaygroundThere is a playground at the West end of the park.RestroomsThere are restrooms on the south side midway through the park.Picnic areaThere are many shaded tables and food trucks

name: Guadalupe Landa
comment: Overall, it was an amazing park! Enough splash pads for loads of kids. We loved the small outside library, outdoor tetris, the building blocks, and the large chess sets.PlaygroundOur kids loved the playground and would stay in one section out of the many areas.RestroomsClean restrooms. üöª They have a changing table in each restroom.Dog-friendlinessIt's a really nice park to bring dogs, especially because if they need to go potty, there is a nearby potty station/dog park on Pearl Street.Picnic areaLoads of picnic areas and sitting areas. You can watch the kids while you eat and still be in the shade. üòé

name: Lorens Portalatin
comment: Love coming to Klyde Warren Park on Sundays for free yoga classes! You bring your own mat and whatever else you may need to feel comfy in the Texas heat while working out and enjoy 45 minutes of a guided yoga session. They also have activities for kids, park areas, and there are food trucks located nearby if you‚Äôre looking for something to eat. Parking is harder to come by so highly recommend giving yourself an extra 15 minutes to find it before any scheduled event.RestroomsThere are restrooms accessible in the park.Dog-friendlinessYou can walk your dogs on a leash in the park.Picnic areaLots of places to sit and enjoy a meal whether it‚Äôs from a park restaurant, food truck or a picnic you enjoy on the grass

name: Rickie Lindley
comment: Wow! Visiting this park was an absolute delight! The kids' splash area was a hit with my little ones, providing endless hours of fun and laughter. And let's talk about the food trucks ‚Äì they were simply phenomenal! From mouthwatering burgers to delicious tacos, there was something for everyone. The ambiance was fantastic, with plenty of shaded seating areas to relax and enjoy our meals. It's safe to say, this park has become our new favorite spot for family outings. Highly recommended! +6

name: Frankie Webb
comment: We decided last minute as we were passing by, to stop today. It was A perfect day for a

name: Niluksha Wickramaarachchi
comment: We had an amazing time at Klyde Warren Park in Dallas! The highlight for us was definitely the giant chess and checkers board. It was so much fun to challenge each other and enjoy a friendly game in such a beautiful setting. The park itself is well-maintained, with plenty of green space, food trucks, and activities for everyone. It's a fantastic spot to relax, play, and soak in the vibrant atmosphere of the city. Highly recommend a visit!

name: Peyman Yazdizadeh
comment: This park is a charming and cozy spot, perfect for both kids and dogs. The play areas are well-maintained, offering a safe and fun environment for children, while the open spaces are great for dogs to run around. It‚Äôs a peaceful place with plenty of seating, making it ideal for families to relax and enjoy time outdoors

name: Vineeth kumar T
comment: Great place for kids and families with best splash pad for kids, play area and open grass field. Bunch of food trucks around and paid parking around.RestroomsPublic restrooms are available at back of Mi CocinaPicnic areaBest picnic area for city view

name: Louie K‚Äôs Up
comment:
This park is more than green grass and skyline views it‚Äôs a breath of fresh purpose. From the playground to the food trucks, Klyde Warren is where families, dreamers, and legacy builders come to recharge. I brought my kids, walked through with my wife, and even sat alone just thanking God for how far we‚Äôve come. ‚úÖ Clean restrooms
‚úÖ Playground stays packed with joy
‚úÖ Dog-friendly for real not just by sign
‚úÖ Perfect picnic energy with space to just be You‚Äôll see culture, peace, art, and resilience all in one stroll. Whether you need clarity, connection, or just a reason to smile this park delivers. Louie K‚Äôs Up approved. üî•üíØüß°

name: Harrison DeMoss
comment: Tasty food options, nice atmosphere, and a good location. This park is always full of life and energy. There's so many things for kids to do here. There are events every week and rotating food trucks. The proximity to the arts district makes this a good addition to an art museum date or family day trip. This park is an iconic landmark of Dallas that is worth checking out. Especially if you have kids.Dog-friendlinessThere are lots of dogs everywhere

name: Rachel Morgan
comment: I stop by this park often because they always have something fun going on. This past weekend, I had the pleasure of being a vendor at their adoption event. As the owner of a dog events company, Pampered Pooch Events, I was more than impressed with their team. My amazing point of contact, the man who made sure everything ran smoothly, was Cruz. He did everything he said he would do when he said he would do it. He made it easy to handle setup, parking, and checked on everyone throughout the event. This was by far the best experience I‚Äôve had working with Cruz, the MVP overseeing their events

name: Vinod Gubba
comment: This is an awesome park in the Dallas downtown area. Kids will have fun time playing here. Lot of food trucks with variety of food options

name: SAMUEL TURRUBIARTE
comment: My visit to Klyde Warren Park in downtown Dallas was nothing short of amazing. We went on a Sunday morning and had no trouble finding plenty of meter parking in the area. This charming park is nestled right on an expressway, surrounded by the tall downtown buildings, which adds a unique urban vibe to the experience.The atmosphere was vibrant, with live music filling the air and vendors selling beautiful artwork and unique pieces. The food trucks lining the park offered a fantastic selection of delicious eats, making it the perfect spot to relax and enjoy the day. I would most definitely come back to Klyde Warren Park and highly recommend it to anyone looking for a fun and lively spot in the heart of the city.Playgroundincredible playground for kids, filled with tons of unique jungle gyms that kept the little ones entertained for hours. It‚Äôs a perfect destination for families looking for a fun, engaging outing.RestroomsThere were restrooms in the park that we could use and they were clean.Dog-friendlinessThe park was also very pet-friendly‚Äîthere was even a dog event that weekend, adding to the lively and welcoming environment. It‚Äôs a perfect destination for families and pet owners a

name: Six Wishez
comment: The park is nice with the amenities, but its too dark there is minimal lights and you cant see your hand before you face. Itz actually kinda weird.. the children playing in the dark cant see the balls. Whose idea was that

name: Lisa Johnston
comment: There should be a bit more security or police presence. Creepy guy on a video chat put his phone inches from my grandson's face after getting a full length back & front view. I got VERY LOUD & the guy left but the officer I spoke with basically said that it is a public place so he couldn't do anything about it. THAT is not ok! Parents beware!

name: michael kilderry
comment: It's a cute little park. Clean, and has play area for children

name: Merritt Glover
comment: This is a lovely example of what a city can provide to the community. Giant chess, splash pad fountains, music, tables and chairs giant connect 4, food trucks! So much silly fun. +2

name: Mister Jon
comment: A park with a few benches and some statues/artwork. The park is not as well upkept as it could be. Benches could use some new paint. There are oak trees throughout the park that offer shade. +8

name: Dena Sims
comment: Wonderful park situated in downtown Dallas. It‚Äôs located across from the Omni Dallas Hotel. Very peaceful. I see a huge mass of iron. There are chairs for sitting and thinking as this iron mass moves around the circle. I refer to it as a sundial. However it‚Äôs far from being a sundial. It make s a complete revolution every day. As I sit there, I can hear it move, minute by minute. I generally visit three times a day to see where the sundial has moved. It‚Äôs an amazing piece of art work.

name: Fil Lorinc
comment: Nice urban park with green space, ample seating, and sculptures.PlaygroundNoneRestroomsNoneDog-friendlinessDoggos welcome :)Picnic areaNone

name: Adrian Lopez
comment:
Not exactly sure what's going on here visually, seems i should do some research but it seems like a sun dial clock thing, not scientific  name so please don't quote me..lol...point being, it is a seemingly relaxing atmosphere here the way it has all been built, feeling secluded yet open enough to see beyond the short walls  it does give off strange and yet welcoming  vibes of another dimension. Take that as you will, i feel each person will have there very own magical experience at this spot in west downtown Dallas, Tx.

Have a Beautifully, Intentional Day!

name: Life Rocks
comment: We came here as part of a virtual scavenger hunt through Puzzling Adventures, to visit and learn about the city. By the time we made it here it was dark, and homeless people were beginning to set up camp in the park for the night.  Maybe it's a nice place to visit during the day, but I definitely didn't feel safe there at night.

name: Vincent Gaines
comment: Beautiful park. Night view is well lot. Right next to the Omni hotel. We visited the night of the super worm moon March 21, 2019 the evening of spring equinox. I caught the moon just as it was rising over the building next door. The red horse neon lit was perfectly positioned to give perspective on the whole scene.

name: Kerry Pagano
comment: This is a wonderful addition to downtown Dallas and makes a great day date and depending on the activities a night one as well.

name: Gustavo Bermudez
comment: Love this place, but sadly it is completely dirty and bunch of people are camping there.

name: Lauren Barnett
comment: Nice small park in Downtown Dallas. Good for a picnic or alone time to think.

name: Derick Snow
comment: Street parking that's free after 6 offers access to this green space next to the hotel.

name: waed ayoub
comment: Small but a lot of fun for kids! The area feels safe and the ground is soft, which is great if kids happen to fall while playing. Nice spot to relax while the kids enjoy themselves. Perfect for a quick family stop in downtown. üòäComfort levelNeutral

name: Adam Abrahamson
comment: It's a nice open space in a sea of buildings. The open space was quite nice, and I'm glad they have it. The kids' park was also well maintained and offers a lot of climbing/obstacle course style of things to do. Very dog friendly and has cleanup and disposal options all around.

name: Fatema Tuj Johora
comment:
Night view: very good
Good place to visit if you are new in Dallas.

name: R4F4
comment:
What to say about Main Street Garden Park?

It's a beautiful park in downtown Dallas.
It has a foosball and ping-pong table, seating area right next to a children's playground, which has structures for several age groups, there is also music playing (the little mermaid was on when we visited.)
It has a nice and ample grass area to play sports and shaded benches around it to sit down and relax.

I highly recommend it!

name: Samuel Reed
comment: The area was bright and open, with plenty of space to walk or sit. The management clearly paid attention to keeping the surroundings tidy. It was a great spot for morning exercise.

name: Frank EC
comment: Good park for children and dogs +6

name: Mrs.Tradillion Nash
comment: I enjoy walking around the park every morning. The grounds are clean and very pretty. A good place to relax.RestroomsNoDog-friendlinessYesPicnic areaYes

name: Sam Towns
comment: The park was conveniently located to our hotel, Residence Inn, so we came a couple times while in Dallas for the weekend. Our first impression was half of it was under construction making it hard to figure out how to get in. Once we walked around to an opening, there were homeless people everywhere just laying around or sitting and staring. So that made it a bit uncomfortable. The playground was nice for our kids to enjoy while we killed time, and the tree landscaping is well done and mature. It took me awhile to figure out where the classical music was coming from and realized it was in the park.  A nice little touch. Overall I think it'd be nice to see it on a good day because we probably caught it on an off day. But I can appreciate it for what it might usually be.

name: MJ
comment: Very fun for Holloween +7

name: the WO
comment: Nice place to go with the family.When we went there was some sort of festival going on .

name: Fil Lorinc
comment:
Largely overlooked and seldom patroned. Could use some attention the from city, especially given the proximity to the highly trafficked Dealy Plaza.

Update October 2023: the grounds were cleaned up and a memorial was installed in the fashion of a sun dial.PlaygroundNoneRestroomsNoneDog-friendlinessDoggos welcome :)Picnic areaNone

name: Gustavo Bermudez
comment: Nice park, but it has become an area where people have built a camp site. Trash everywhere now.

name: Kerry Pagano
comment: This is a great place for families, couples, anyone.

name: Johanna Giglioli
comment: Trash and bad smell.

name: Willy Lanev
comment: Good. Place  sleep

name: jim s
comment: Worth your respect . . .

name: Troy Windhorst
comment: Small green space in the midst of the concrete jungle this is downtown Dallas. Essentially a spot to take a break, with nothing spectacular, there are enough interesting features to please the eyes. +4

name: J
comment: The architecture is unique and nice, but the homeless here are so hostile. We're just taking pictures and he harasses us saying he doesn't want him to be in the picture. Instead of enjoying the place we just left.  Don't come here.

name: Margot B
comment: It was excellent. The No Kings Protest was violent free and excellent as well +3

name: Freddy Govantes
comment: Went for No Kings Rally. Great turn out and super easy to get to.

name: Bruce InCharlotte
comment:
There was some sort of event being set up today (eclipse?) so I didn't get to explore Pacific Plaza as much as I would have liked. I could still walk around a bit. This lovely open and green space is airy and fresh and while there isn't a buffer for noise, it was still calmer and more peaceful than most.

The park has some swings and play space for the little ones. A small low fence around it would be helpful.PlaygroundThere are some play areas here.RestroomsI did not see any public restrooms.Dog-friendlinessLeashed dogs are permitted.Picnic areaThere is some seating here.

name: Lavette Dameron
comment: Dallas Soul Flower Music Fest! Great times and great vibes! ‚ù§Ô∏è

name: Samuel Reed
comment: The place offered a peaceful break from city noise. The air was clean, and the environment felt safe. It was nice to see people respecting the space and keeping it neat.

name: Dena Sims
comment: Great vista in this downtown park. It appears to be in a courtyard surrounded by tall buildings. It‚Äôs a place to sit under many shade trees and people watch as the walk through the park. Sometimes I spot people playing soccer, football and frisbee.  The grass in this park is green and inviting +9

name: Caden Alexander
comment: It's a nice park for walking dogs, but it's usually accompanied by a few homeless individuals.

name: R4F4
comment:
What to say about the Pacific Plaza?

What a great place to sit down and relax, lay on the grass or grab and table and eat during lunch break. It also has a small playground with seesaws.seesaw.

I highly recommend it!Picnic areaMany tables and seats.

name: Jason Russell
comment: Great little peaceful place right in the middle of downtown Dallas. Stop by here to have lunch while you're in the city really nice place. Lots of activities to do with your kids putting a of places just to sit and hang out. You should go check it out really nice +11

name: Kenia L
comment: I wasn't expecting much, but it was quite nice, I'll definitely go back another time to hang out, it's comfortable, you can eat your food right there, and it's very nice to look around.

name: Perri-A Perri-A
comment: Sooo beautiful at night +24

name: Metro One Pest Control
comment:
Great people!
Familiar setting!

Great to see so many people coming, It was fun and peaceful üá∫üá∏üíó

name: Sam Towns
comment: This was a nice park and playground in walking distance from our hotel. The landscaping is beautiful and the building views set a nice scene. We had fun on a Sunday morning with our kids. The only thing was there was a large group of homeless people (30+) sleeping in one corner of the park which was a bit weird. It seems the city has a major homeless problem as we encountered them everywhere we went downtown.

name: Anand Arya
comment: Wonderful park and great views of the city. Small kids play area. Homeless people around it.

name: Sara Boyer
comment: Lovely park! My Husband and I had fun walking around and exploring the area! It is a calming place to escape the hustle and bustle of the city!

name: Maritza Ortega
comment: Fabulous addition to Downtown Dallas! A green space in the heart of Dallas with beautiful views of the city buildings! The best views happen at sunset!! +24

name: Madison Rainbow
comment: This gorgeous 3.4 acre park opens October 14, 2019! +43

name: Dezirae Rae
comment: I love this park. Its so open and beautiful! Our dogs love it. The park is pretty clean.

name: Fil Lorinc
comment: Great downtown corridor home to Campisi's, Woolworth, Starship Bagel, and the famous Dallas Eyeball sculpture and accompanying lawn.PlaygroundNoneRestroomsNo public restroomsDog-friendlinessDoggos welcome :)Picnic areaNo picnic area, per se, however there are tables and chairs typically put out by Starship Bagel

name: Lauren B
comment: One of the most dangerous areas at night.

name: Rebecca Werner
comment: Right next to the Giant Eyeball, Stone Street Gardens is a collection of restaurants in an older building.

name: Teqmok
comment: It's just a walkway connecting Elm St and Main St.

comment: Cool sculpture‚Ä¶. That‚Äôs it.

name: Soud Zaidan
comment: Food was disgusting and bartender was rude.

name: David Williams
comment: Pretty cool area!!

name: M
comment: Great new little park in the West End.  It has swings, a fountain, walking paths and games such as Foose ball and ping-pong.  The park has ample seating for people to take a break from their afternoon adventures.   It has charging stations for your electronics and it has overhead fans in some places so you can cool off.  It is beautifully landscaped and it has dedicated areas near the front of the park as pet relief areas. +19

name: Samuel Reed
comment: The walking tracks were smooth and clean. Many people were jogging and exercising, creating a healthy vibe.

name: Fil Lorinc
comment: Really

name: Matthew Walker
comment: This isn't so much a review as a warning so I'm giving it 5 stars due to it being a park: the charging stations do not work, be warned.

name: Ola Nesgovorov
comment: Very nice and clean park with lots of places to sit and enjoy the weather

name: Paula Dodd Barnes
comment: A great square space of old days in the Dallas West End. Industry's used to thrive here. Now people are walking and living right here all around.

name: Joanna Serrano
comment: Great historic location in downtown! +5

name: Andrew Boggs
comment: Very clean little park in the middle of everything that would be perfect for eating lunch or reading a book.

name: Mindy P
comment: Really nice place with swings, foosball, ping pong, bags, tables/chairs, grassy area.

name: Codie Angle
comment: This park is a welcome addition to the neighborhood! The unique water feature and the relaxing swings are wonderful. I look forward to spending lots of time here. The electricity outlets will be helpful if you are looking for a change of scenery while working from home!
